title: Dart
description: A general Dart quick reference covering core syntax, functions, collections, control flow, operators, async, regex, date/time, packages, CLI tooling, common errors, and practical scripting patterns.

categories.title: Installation and Tooling
categories.description: SDK basics, project commands, formatting, analysis, and running scripts.

items.title: Dart SDK commands
items.description: Common `dart` CLI commands.

rows: Generate API docs (dartdoc via tool integration)

items.example:
dart --version
dart create my_app
cd my_app
dart run
dart format .
dart analyze

items.title: pub / packages
items.description: Dependencies are managed via pub in `pubspec.yaml`.
items.example:
dart pub add http
dart pub add --dev lints
dart pub get

categories.title: Basic Functionality
categories.description: Core language basics: types, variables, strings, null safety, and basic I/O.

items.title: Variables and types
items.description: Dart is sound null-safe. Prefer explicit types or `final`/`const` when possible.

items.title: Strings
items.description: Strings support interpolation with `$var` and `${expr}`.

items.title: Printing, stdin, and args
items.description: Use `dart:io` for console input and args via `List<String> args`.

categories.title: Functions
categories.description: Parameters, returns, scope, anonymous functions, and common built-ins.

items.title: Parameters
items.description: Dart supports positional, optional positional, named, and required named parameters.

rows: int add(int a, int b) => a + b;
void log({String level = 'INFO', required String msg}) { ... }

items.title: Returns
items.description: Use explicit return types; functions returning nothing use `void`.

items.title: Scope
items.description: Lexical scoping; closures capture variables.

rows: int makeAdder(int a) => (int b) => a + b;

items.title: Anonymous functions
items.description: Use lambdas in collection ops and callbacks.

items.title: Built-in and predefined functions
items.description: Core functions and common APIs on core types.

categories.title: Filters
categories.description: Filtering and transforming data using Iterable APIs.

items.title: where/map/reduce
items.description: Most collection operators return Iterables; call toList/toSet when needed.

categories.title: Globals
categories.description: Environment variables, process information, and runtime basics.

items.title: dart:io Platform and Process
items.description: Useful for scripts and administration tasks.

categories.title: Packages/Modules
categories.description: Imports, libraries, pub packages, and common structure.

items.title: Imports
items.description: Use package imports for dependencies and relative imports inside your package.

items.title: pubspec structure
items.description: Key sections you’ll commonly edit.
items.example:
name: my_app
environment:
  sdk: '>=3.0.0 <4.0.0'
dependencies:
  http: ^1.0.0

categories.title: Operators
categories.description: Arithmetic, comparison, null-aware, type, and cascade operators.

items.title: Operator quick table
items.description: Common operators used day-to-day.

categories.title: Arrays
categories.description: Lists, sets, and maps (Dart’s primary collection types).

items.title: List basics
items.description: Lists are ordered collections (similar to arrays).

items.title: Sets and Maps
items.description: Sets hold unique values; Maps store key/value pairs.

items.title: Collection if/for and spreads
items.description: Build collection literals conditionally or from loops; spread other collections.

items.title: Loop constructs
items.description: Prefer for-in for collections; use await for for streams.

items.title: break/continue and labels
items.description: Use labeled break/continue for nested loops.

items.title: if/else and ternary
items.description: Use ?? and ?. with null safety for concise control flow.

items.title: switch
items.description: Switch is useful for simple branching; include default when appropriate.

items.title: assert
items.description: Assertions help catch mistakes early (enabled in debug mode).

categories.title: Regular Expressions
categories.description: Use RegExp for matching, capturing, and replacement.

items.title: Matching and captures
items.description: Use hasMatch/firstMatch/allMatches; access capture groups with group(i).

items.title: Replace
items.description: Use replaceAll / replaceFirst / replaceAllMapped.

items.title: RegExp flags
items.description: Configure behavior with RegExp options.
items.example: final re = RegExp('^foo$', multiLine: true, caseSensitive: false);

categories.title: Data and Time
categories.description: DateTime, Duration, parsing/formatting, and time zones.

items.title: DateTime and Duration
items.description: DateTime is an instant in time (local/UTC). Duration is a time span.

items.title: Formatting (intl)
items.description: For locale-aware formatting, use the intl package.
items.example:
// Requires: package:intl
// final s = DateFormat('yyyy-MM-dd').format(DateTime.now());

categories.title: Database interactions
categories.description: Typical patterns using community database packages (parameterized queries, transactions).

items.title: General best practices
items.description: Use placeholders/parameters, transactions, and close resources.

rows: Avoid SQL injection and quoting errors.
Prevent hung queries from stalling the app.

items.example: // Package APIs vary. Prefer parameterized queries and transactions.

items.title: Future and async/await
items.description: Use async/await for readable async code; handle errors with try/catch.

items.title: Streams
items.description: Streams represent async sequences; use await for and listen.

categories.title: Scripting and Administration
categories.description: Files, directories, processes, and common CLI patterns.

items.title: Files and directories
items.description: Use dart:io File/Directory for filesystem operations.

items.title: Running external commands
items.description: Use Process.run for simple calls; Process.start for streaming I/O.

categories.title: HTTP and JSON
categories.description: Common networking and JSON patterns for scripts and services.

items.title: JSON encode/decode
items.description: Use dart:convert for JSON (Map<String, dynamic> is typical).

rows: final m = jsonDecode(s) as Map<String, dynamic>;

items.title: HTTP requests (http package)
items.description: The http package is commonly used for simple REST calls.
items.example:
// Requires: package:http
// final r = await http.get(Uri.parse('https://example.com'));

categories.title: Common Errors
categories.description: Frequent Dart errors/exceptions and typical fixes.

items.title: Null safety runtime errors
items.description: Most common issue: using ! incorrectly or calling a method on null.

rows: Null check operator used on a null value
Used ! on a nullable that was null
Use ??, ?., or a guard if (x == null) return;
Called a method on null or wrong type
Check nullability; validate types and casts

items.title: Type and format errors
items.description: Parsing and casting errors are common in I/O and JSON.

rows: type 'X' is not a subtype of type 'Y'
Cast carefully; validate structure; use typed parsing
Initialize before use or make nullable
